required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nephrotoxicity of Iopamidol Versus Iodixanol in High-Risk Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Nephrotoxicity of Iopamidol Versus Iodixanol in High-Risk Patients:A Multicentre Randomized Double-Blind Trail of Contrast-Induced Nephropathy in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University
Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the incidence of contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) following the administration of iopamidol-370 (Iopamiro-370) and iodixanol-320 (Visipaque 320) in patients with chronic kidney disease undergoing coronary angiography.

detailed_description.textblock: To compare the incidence of contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN)(an absolute SCr increase 0.5 mg/dL from baseline) following the administration of iopamidol-370 (Iopamiro-370) and iodixanol-320 (Visipaque 320) in patients with chronic kidney disease (serum creatinine level more than 1.5 mg/dL for men and more than 1.3 mg/dL for women or preprocedural estimated glomerular ﬁltration rate(eGFR):15-60 mL/min/1.73 m2) undergoing coronary angiography.

clinical_study.why_stopped: There were few eligible subjects from other centers.

primary_outcome.description: Contrast-Induced Nephropathy was defined as an increase in serum creatinine of more than 0.5 mg/dl or 25% from the baseline within 48-72 h of contrast exposure

secondary_outcome.measure: A relative increase in serum creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: A relative increase in serum creatinine was defined as more than 25% increase in serum creatinine within 48-72 h of contrast exposure.

secondary_outcome.measure: A relative increase in estimated glomerular ﬁltration rate (eGFR)
secondary_outcome.description: A relative increase in eGFR was defined as more than 25% increase in eGFR within 48-72 h of contrast exposure

secondary_outcome.measure: An absolute increase in serum creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: An absolute increase in serum creatinine within 48-72 h of contrast exposure

Major adverse clinical events: death, requiring renal replacement therapy, 2nd myocardial infarction,target revascularization,acute heart failure, mechanical ventilation,2nd angina,tachyarrhythmia,hypotension,intra-aortic balloon pump and stroke

Major adverse clinical events: death, requiring renal replacement therapy, acute myocardial infarction,target revascularization,acute heart failure, mechanical ventilation,2nd angina,tachyarrhythmia,hypotension,intra-aortic balloon pump and stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: An significant increase in serum creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: An significant increase in serum creatinine was defined as an increase in serum creatinine of more than 1.0 mg/dl from the baseline within 48-72 h of contrast exposure

Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury was defined as an increase in serum creatinine concentration of more than 0.3 mg/dL from the baseline value at 48 hours after administration of the contrast exposure or the need for dialysis

intervention.description: Iopamiro-370 (Iopamidol injection 76%) is provided in single dose bottles/vials, ready to use, aqueous, nonpyrogenic, colorless to pale yellow sterile solution
Visipaque 320 (iodixanol) injection is provided in bottles/flexible containers, ready to use sterile, pyrogen-free colorless to pale yellow solution
